alert.note: Alert for Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Charles City, northern Prince George, New Kent, northwestern James City and northwestern Surry Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Garysville, or near Charles City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hopewell, New Kent, Charles City, Claremont, Talleysville, Roxbury, Prince George, Adkins Store, Rustic, Ruthville, Burrowsville, Garysville, Providence Forge, Holdcroft, Cabin Point, Barhamsville, Jordans Point, Taylors Corner, Chickahominy Shore and Wayside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; James City; New Kent; Prince George; Surry
